title: How to Add Filling to a Cupcake

steps.title: Bake your cupcakes and let them cool completely.
steps.content: Bake your cupcakes and let them cool completely. If you fill the cupcakes while they are still warm, the filling will melt and turn the cupcakes gooey. You can bake the cupcakes from scratch using your favorite recipe, or you can bake them using a boxed mix.

steps.title: Insert a decorating tip into a piping bag.
steps.content: Insert a decorating tip into a piping bag. Snip off the bottom of a piping bag first, then insert a decorating tip into the bag. A small, sound tip will work the best, but you can use a larger star-shaped tip as well. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fill the bag with 1 to 2 tablespoons of your desired filling.
steps.content: Fill the bag with 1 to 2 tablespoons of your desired filling. Smooth fillings, such as custard, puddings , buttercream frosting , or whipped cream will work the best. You can also try jam or jelly, but make sure that it's not the chunky kind, otherwise you might clog the tip. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Insert the tip into the top of the cupcake.
steps.content: Insert the tip into the top of the cupcake. Push it into the cupcake by about 1 inch (2.54 centimeters). You do not need to cut a hole into the cupcake first, but you can if you prefer. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Squeeze the filling into the cupcake.
steps.content: Squeeze the filling into the cupcake. Depending on the size of the cupcake, you should be able to squeeze 1 to 2 tablespoons of filling into it. If the filling starts to leak outside of the hole, stop; you have filled the cupcake as much as possible. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Frost and decorate the cupcake as desired.
steps.content: Frost and decorate the cupcake as desired. Use a piping bag and a large round or star shaped decorator's tip to pipe buttercream frosting onto the cupcake. You can also use chocolate ganache. Glace icing made from powdered sugar and water is not recommended, however; it is too thin and will sink into the hole.

steps.title: Start with baked and cooled cupcakes.
steps.content: Start with baked and cooled cupcakes. You can make the cupcakes from scratch, or you can make them using a store-bought mix. Once you finish baking the cupcakes, let them cool completely. If you don't, the filling will melt. This method is great for making candy-filled cupcakes.

steps.title: Insert a paring knife into the top of the cupcake at an angle.
steps.content: Insert a paring knife into the top of the cupcake at an angle. Hold the blade so that the flat side is facing the edge of the cupcake. It should by at a 45-degree angle to the cupcake. [5] X Research source Don't push the blade too deep into the cupcake, otherwise the frosting will come out the bottom. If you don't have a paring knife, you can use a teaspoon instead. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Cut a cone out of the cupcake.
steps.content: Cut a cone out of the cupcake. Keep the tip of the blade inside the center of the cupcake. Rotate the cupcake while cutting around the top of the cupcake in a circle. Aim to make the hole about 1 inch (2.54 centimeters) wide. [7] X Research source To make candy-filled cupcakes, make the hole about 1 inch (2.54 centimeters) deep. [8] X Research source You can also use a cupcake corer to make a hole in the cupcake.

steps.title: Pull the cone shape out of the cupcake.
steps.content: Pull the cone shape out of the cupcake. Cut the cone in half and discard the pointed part. You will use the top, flat part to plug the hole at the end. [9] X Research source You can also eat the pointed part or save it to make cake pops.

steps.title: Fill the hole halfway with your favorite filling.
steps.content: Fill the hole halfway with your favorite filling. Fill a plastic bag or a piping bag with your favorite filling. Snip the tip off, and pipe the filling into the hole. You do not need to insert a decorator's tip into the bag. [10] X Research source Buttercream frosting , custard, and whipped cream are all great options. You can also try jam or lemon curd for something more interesting. Do not fill the hole more than halfway, otherwise the filling will leak out in the next step. To make candy-filled cupcakes, fill the hole with 1 teaspoon of sprinkles. Try to use a variety of different shapes, sizes, and colors. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Plug the hole in the cupcake.
steps.content: Plug the hole in the cupcake. Place the top part of the cone back onto the cupcake; make sure that the smooth side of the plug (not the cut part) is facing up. Gently press down on the plug to seal it, but not so hard that the filling comes out.

steps.title: Frost the cupcake as desired.
steps.content: Frost the cupcake as desired. You can frost the cupcake using a piping bag and buttercream frosting. You can also pour some glace icing made from powdered sugar and water. Chocolate ganache would also work well.

steps.title: Bake your cupcakes and let them cool down completely.
steps.content: Bake your cupcakes and let them cool down completely. You can make the cupcakes from scratch or you can use a boxed recipe. Be sure to let them cool completely, otherwise the filling will melt.

steps.title: Push an apple corer into the center of the cupcake.
steps.content: Push an apple corer into the center of the cupcake. You can also use a small melon scoop instead. If you are using an apple corer, be careful not to push it in too deep, or the frosting will come out of the bottom of the cupcake. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Rotate the corer.
steps.content: Rotate the corer. Keep the corer in place as you twist it. The edges of the corer will cut into the cupcake and create a hole. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the corer out of the cupcake.
steps.content: Pull the corer out of the cupcake. Discard the cupcake that's inside the corer or save it to make cake pops. You can also eat it instead.

steps.title: Fill the cupcakes with your desired filling.
steps.content: Fill the cupcakes with your desired filling. You can fill your cupcakes with just about anything, from custard to jam to buttercream frosting . If you are using frosting, you can pipe it into the hole with a piping bag. [14] X Research source If you are using a more fluid filling, such as custard or jam, or you can push it into the hole with a small teaspoon.

steps.title: Decorate the cupcake.
steps.content: Decorate the cupcake. While easy, this method leaves behind a hole on top of the cupcake. Use a piping bag fitted with a large round or star shaped tip to pipe buttercream frosting onto the cupcake. Chocolate ganache and glace icing made from powdered sugar and water is not recommended for this method because it is too translucent and will mix into the filling.

steps.title: Preheat your oven and prepare the cupcake pan.
steps.content: Preheat your oven and prepare the cupcake pan. Preheat the oven to the temperature specified on your recipe. For most recipes, this will be around 350°F (177°C), but yours may be different. Next, insert cupcake liners into your cupcake pan. This method is recommended for chocolate and jam fillings. It is not recommended for frosting, pudding, or cream fillings.

steps.title: Prepare your cupcake batter.
steps.content: Prepare your cupcake batter. You can make the cupcake batter from scratch, or you can use a boxed mix. Follow the directions on the recipe closely.

steps.title: Fill the cupcake liners one-third of the way with batter.
steps.content: Fill the cupcake liners one-third of the way with batter. You can do this using an ice cream scoop, a sauce ladle, or a tablespoon. Save the rest of the batter for later. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Add 1 teaspoon of your desired filling into the center of each cupcake.
steps.content: Add 1 teaspoon of your desired filling into the center of each cupcake. Jam or jelly would work the best for this. You can also try melted chocolate. Whipped cream or frosting are not recommended, however, because they will melt. [16] X Research source This amount is for standard-sized cupcakes. If you are making mini cupcakes, try ½ teaspoon instead.

steps.title: Fill the liners with more batter.
steps.content: Fill the liners with more batter. Add enough batter until they are about two-thirds to three-quarters of the way full. Do not over-fill the liners, or the cupcakes will overflow. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Bake the cupcakes according to the directions on the recipe.
steps.content: Bake the cupcakes according to the directions on the recipe. Most cupcakes will be ready in about 20 minutes, but your recipe may be different. Read the directions, and bake the cupcakes according to that.

steps.title: Let the cupcakes cool completely before frosting them.
steps.content: Let the cupcakes cool completely before frosting them. Allow them to cool in the pan for about 5 minutes first, then take them out of the pan. Allow them to finish cooling on a wire rack before frosting them. You can frost the cupcakes with buttercream frosting , chocolate ganache, or glace icing. Do not frost the cupcakes while they are still warm, or the frosting will melt.
